Reviews.Title: “Super place and great location!”
Reviews.Author: HappyBlueDragon
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, the bright colors, the breakfast - just everything about it was super! The kids enjoyed it too!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: SML1704
Reviews.Content: A fantastic welcome from the owners of this small boutique hotel within 10 minutes walk of La Louvre. Nice, clean, bright room. A bit on the small side, but I'd rather have an attractive and contemporary room, rather than a large dated one. Breakfast was absolutely lovely, with fresh local ingerdients. Great staff and all speak English, which was a termendous help. Would definitely stay again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and well located”
Reviews.Author: Guilia8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Crayon for one night. It is perfectly located near the Louvre, in the very centre of Paris and it was easy to find coming from Gare du Nord, where we arrived. The hotel has been recently refurbished and looks fresh and clean. The room we had was on the top floor (6th) and had a comfortable bed and ensuite bathroom. Mind that the lift only stops at the 5th level so if you have a room on the 6th there are a couple of stairs to do. We had overall a good experience, however we found the room noisy given the fact that you can hear the elevator going up and down and other electrical.

Reviews.Title: “Good but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Soobee38
Reviews.Content: Pro's - Liked the quirkiness of the hotel, the bed, shower, location and honesty bar. Cons - Room small, noise from inside the hotel, both across the courtyard and in the (very small) corridor outside the room and price. I think we could have got better value elsewhere. We wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Original, stylish and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Fran4419
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enojyed our long weekend in this hotel. The location is superb for the Louvre and pretty much all of the main Paris attractions. The hotel itself is like no other I've been to. It's so stylish and considered, with fantastic colours and design. It even smells lovely! The staff are very friendly and accomodating. The only negative if I was pressed for one is the size of the rooms. They are very small but they're also quirky and the bed is comfortable. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A design hotel that's easy on your wallet”
Reviews.Author: flowersui
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated near the Louvre, this recently opened hotel is a real gem if you like design and originality. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was small and the bathroom miniscule but the decoration is fun and fairly practical in terms of storage. Bed was extremely cosy and comfortable and wifi worked in the room. The only down side...the noise. Not from the street outside (no problems there) but the wall between the room and corridor was almost non-existant and any movement could be heard. Breakfast was very good with a wide choice, although the space was tiny so just hope everyone isn't there at the same time as you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, couldn't believe the price”
Reviews.Author: Jhansfor
Reviews.Content: Really nice Boutique hotel, love the theme. Rooms are small but this is central Paris and they're more than comfortable. Bed was excellent, recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique hotel, great hosts and fantastic location! Number 1 choice for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Popscolin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of February. It's about 5 mins walk from Chatelet les Halles, which is on the main line from CDG (approx 40 mins). It's a great location, not far from the louvre, with lots of small bars and bistros within metres of the hotel. We had a very warm welcome to the hotel and loved the decor in reception. There is free wifi and lots of Paris guide books available to borrow. Our room was perfect. We were in 403. Lovely jade green room and all the important things were perfect- large wonderfully comfortable bed, amazing sheets and a shower to die for. I also recommend the breakfasts, nice selection including meats, cheeses, pastries, yoghurt, fruits, boilled eggs, breads and cereals as well as good coffee. There is also and honesty bar which includes hot drinks and there is free fruit. Staff were really helpful arranging our night out at the cabaret, and generally being friendly and accomodating. As you may have guessed I can't recommend this place highly enough and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and good location”
Reviews.Author: Arabella80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel Crayon on December 2011 for one night. That was short city break. The hotel is very stylish, seems like a good desinger worked on the hotel's style. Though the rooms are small (as in the most hotels in paris), they are very cosy and each room has a special aroma (the dispencer startes working as lom as ypu are entering the room). And aroma is very nice and light, and you can choose aroma of your room while you are checking in. . A bath kit is also very aromatic with soap with some indians spices, shampoo with other aromas, etc. There are books in several languages at the bedside table in case you have time to read. The lobby of the hotel and toilet are very stylish indeed. Walls in toilet are especially nice:) instead of wall-papers, crayons are used to write whatever you want on the walls, and many funny expressions are written. Lobby is the most well-designed spot in the hotel and extremely cosy. Good tea and coffee are served there. And free fruites are offered to the guests. The staff is very helpful and speak excellent English. The location is good, in the heart of the city with shops and cafes around. Overall, the hotel is pleasant plac to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for better in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ScottandShannon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Crayon as our last stay on our honeymoon, and we could not have been happier. We booked with some friends we were meeting, but (I am assuming because we mentioned it was our honeymoon) we got upgraded to the junior suite which was incredibly spacious and beautiful. The room was huge with the largest bathtub I've ever seen and bed was extremely comfortable. The staff was all extremely courteous and very helpful with making suggestions in the area and helping us find different attractions or places to eat. We did not bring a computer, but they keep a laptop at the front desk for guests to use so we used this almost every day we stayed. They also have a lot of Paris guide books at the front desk that they are very generous about lending to you. All in all, this was a lovely stay and we were very complimentary to our friends for picking such a lovely place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Tres Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: GreekGoddess2U
Reviews.Content: I had a really great first experience in Paris and the Hotel Crayon was a big part of it. I researched all the Districts first and found the location of this hotel, in the 1st arr. to be very convenient to everything with shops, cafe's, markets, the Louvre and many other points of interest all within walking distance. Hotels in Paris are mostly all small, so I knew that my hotel room would be small by American standards, however the room was very clean, nicely appointed, free wi-fi, great shower products, heating/ac, a the downy plush double sized bed was meant for great sleeps. The Hotel staff was very very accommodating and seemed excited for me that I was enjoying my daily Paris forays. They were helpful with maps, how to use the Metro, etc. Just super friendly - all of them, it was nice to see their smiles at the end of each day. In the neighborhood just outside the hotel was a Pizzeria, a French Bistro/Bar, and a sushi joint. I really enjoyed the Bistro and they were really great about filling my ice bucket for me as there is no ice machine in the Hotel. (there is a SMEG Refrigerator filled with drinks and a few trays of ice cubes however, but I would have wiped out their ice daily). There is also an honor bar in the lobby to have a a cocktail for a small fee. The hotel stored my luggage on my last day since I was not to depart for CDG til 5 pm. I also reco Super Shuttle for easy and reasonable transfers to and from any of the major airports. 48 Euro Roundtrip. Easy peasy for a first timer. My best days were spent "Getting Lost" and meandering the highlty inviting cobbled streets that twisted along, populated with delightful and amusing storefront windows. I got in the habit of picking up a small baguette, some good deli terrine or rillettes and some cheese at the end of the day to eat for breakfast in my room as the typical Parisienne breakfast is a croissant and cafe au lait, I preferred more substance. I also recommend taking the Les Halles Metro on the 4 Line to Port Clignacourt (3.70 Euro round trip) in order to go to the Les Puces Saint-Ouen Flea Market. It was full of beautiful vintage finds ranging from high end antiques to low-brow bargains (I got a Le Creuset #18 casserole in good used condition for 1 Euro and chic vintage sundress for 10 Euro, some vintage lobster-motif ramekins for 40 Euro, etc.) I highly recommend the hotel for its pleasantness, location, price, and overall part of my Paris experience :)

Reviews.Title: “non lasciatevelo scappare!”
Reviews.Author: PapoItalia
Reviews.Content: La zona, il prezzo, l'estetica e la simpatia dello staff fanno di questo hotel qualcosa di imperdibile! Inutile dire che le stanze sono veramente piccole (una doppia è veramente appena sufficiente per 2 persone)... ma i colori e l'originalità degli arredi ne distolgono l'attenzione e rendono il soggiorno piacevole. Lo staff alla reception è molto disponibilie e la location è perfetta per visitare il centro di Parigi. Sconsigliata la colazione non perchè non qualitativa, ma solo perche servita nei sotterranei, un po' claustrofobici.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Spot”
Reviews.Author: smcelroy
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying in this hotel. First time they were still in the process of doing the renovations, but it had little impact on my stay. This time I was staying with three work colleagues, all who said they would stay again next time when in Paris. It is a great location with many of the famous landmarks within easy walking distance. The rooms are small, but so are most hotels in Paris. But they have made the place very funky with their art deco appearance. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Would be happy to stay there again and will do so when on business or my wife. Would be a little on the small side for families though

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it, but they made it hard!”
Reviews.Author: miss_marie_11
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful design, but unfortunately a frustrating and disappointing experience. It was my partners first tripe to Europe so I wanted it to be special. We booked the suite months in advance, and were impressed by their quick and friendly response when we requested early check in as our flight arrived at 6am. It turned out not to be possible, but this didn't bother us as much as being told on arrival that we could only have the suite for 2 nights instead of 4 because a movie was going to be filmed in there. Again they were very friendly and helpful, giving us a free breakfast that morning and offering us a discount on a smaller room for the other 2 nights, which we accepted. The suite was BEAUTIFUL, we loved it, and decided not to hold a grudge and to enjoy ourselves. Unfortunately, the double room we were moved to had two single beds joined together, which was incredibly uncomfortable to sleep on and put a dampener on our romantic trip. It was a much much smaller and noisier, and we missed our nice room! But as the rest of the service was very good we decided to book a room for 2 nights a week later when we were back in Paris. We requested that it be a room with a proper double bed, which they promised, and I double checked the dates with them because it was for the day before our flight home and I didn't want any more stuff ups. However when we arrived back to check in, we were told we had only booked the room for 1 night, and that there was no space for the second night. The room had two single beds again, despite their promise, and in the morning we were forced to change hotels (not what we wanted to spend our last day in Paris doing!!!). Furthermore when we spoke to the manager about it, he insisted that we had only booked one night, not accepting any responsibility for the mistake. As I had made a point of double checking the dates, I found this downright rude. We were offered another smaller discount, but at this point it frankly did not make up for the stress of repeatedly getting stuffed around. Instead of changing rooms once, we had to change 3 times, and as any traveler knows repacking your suitcase and moving rooms over and over is not a fun way to spend your holiday. I really wanted to love this place, but they made it incredibly hard. They need to make some changes to their procedures so that customers aren't let down repeatedly like that, in particular I thought it was inappropriate for them not to contact us earlier to tell us we couldn't have the room we booked for the whole trip as it denied us the opportunity to book another hotel. In the end we didn't let the frustration and disappointment ruin our holiday, but they certainly pushed us to the edge. My recommendation to other travelers is to book the suite if you want a decent sized room, and to double check and insist on written confirmation of your bookings (my partner requested confirmation of our second booking but was told it wasn't necessary).

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Sexy”
Reviews.Author: Whirlwind_Girl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Crayon is in the 1st Arrondisement, a short walk from Paris's three major art museums - Louvre, Musee d'Orsay (Impressionism) and Georges Pompidou (modern art). Very close by is Rue Montorgueil, a popular pedestrian street filled with reasonably priced (for Paris) restaurants and food markets. Chatelet Les Halles Metro is the stop for several subway and train lines . . . Very convenient. So much for the superb location. The rooms are jewel like. Yes, my single chamber was small, enough space for the comfy double bed and walkway around it, but the brightly painted walls and sexy, yet delicately rendered art cheered me! When I returned to my apartment in the US, I thought, What's with this space? It is not necessary when one has such a pleasing, happy decor. The floor to ceiling tiled and colorfully lit shower is unbelievable. Two shower heads, one on the ceiling and one on a moveable hose, are perfect. My sink, however, was too tiny and it was hard to wash my face without splashing water everywhere. The staff is so nice and always helpful. When I needed to rest during the day in a blackened room, the maid came by and prepared my room for me. They arranged for cabs, printed my boarding pass, and helped me with my luggage. If you get hungry in the middle of night, just go downstairs to the cafe next door. It is open 24-7.

Reviews.Title: “very charming”
Reviews.Author: Debra R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the end of September for three nights and enjoyed our stay. Great safe location with a great bakery, cafe and bistro just down the street. The managers were wonderful and extremely helpful. The renovation was just being completed when we were there. It is done vert tasteful and fun. The breakfast ladies are very nice and the breakfast was very good. The room was very small but we were there only to sleep so that did not bother us too much. It's a little expensive by American standards but we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely”
Reviews.Author: jensho
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. It was perfect for a long weekend away from London. I love the design of the hotel. Great boutique design without taking itself to seriously. I found it impossible to be in a bad mood while there. Great location and gracious staff made it even more enjoyable. I will definitely be returning the next time I visit Paris.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Crayon
HotelInfo.Address: 25 rue du Bouloi | 1st Arr., 75001 Paris, France
